nodes.summary: Dynamic scripting language for web development with wide browser support.
Superset of JavaScript that adds static typing and other features.
JavaScript library for building user interfaces, especially single-page applications.
TypeScript-based web application framework led by Google.
Progressive JavaScript framework for building user interfaces and SPAs.
JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine for server-side programming.
High-level language known for readability and versatility in data science and web dev.
High-level Python web framework that encourages rapid development.
Lightweight Python web framework that's easy to get started with.
Fundamental package for scientific computing with Python.
Data analysis and manipulation library built on top of NumPy.
Class-based, object-oriented language designed for portability and security.
Modern programming language that runs on the JVM, interoperable with Java.
Application framework and inversion of control container for Java.
Mobile operating system and development platform based on Java/Kotlin.
General-purpose, procedural language that influenced many modern languages.
Extension of C with object-oriented features, used for system/application development.
Systems language focusing on safety, particularly safe concurrency.
Statically typed language designed at Google for simplicity and efficiency.
Dynamic, object-oriented language designed for programmer happiness.
Server-side web application framework written in Ruby.
DSL for quickly creating web applications in Ruby with minimal effort.
Testing framework for Ruby, popular in behavior-driven development.
Server-side scripting language designed for web development.
PHP web application framework with elegant syntax.
Content management system written in PHP, powering many websites.
Domain-specific language for managing data in relational databases.
Powerful, open-source object-relational database system.
NoSQL database that uses JSON-like documents with optional schemas.
Query language for APIs and a runtime for executing those queries.
